numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Many applicants have a richer family.
2. Many applicants have a family legacy.
3. Many colleges accept these applicants.
4. Some applicants do not have a family legacy.
5. Some applicants are poor.
6. Many Ivy League colleges do not accept these applicants.
7. The graph uses gray and black colors.
8. The graph also uses gray filling.
9. This use is confusing.
10. At first, it is hard to understand the graph.
11. Some applicants are as good as other applicants.
12. Some colleges care about family legacy.
13. I ask why colleges accept richer applicants with a family legacy.
14. I ask why colleges do not accept applicants without a family legacy.
15. Some colleges mostly accept family legacy applicants.
16. I ask how this affects the money that is poured into a college.
17. I go to a school.
18. At my school, a few families have legacies in the high school.
19. Many students from these families want to get into Ivy League schools.
20. The headline is: Excepted Legacy or Not?
